snippet: For reasons that are not yet clear, hospitals in the Midwest and West are seeing an unusually large spike in suspected cases and a large number of children who need critical care.
abstract: Hospitals in Midwest and West, for reasons that are not yet clear, are seeing an unusually large spike in children sickened with human enterovirus 68, which causes fever, coughing and other intense symptoms that mimic a particularly bad cold.

byline.original: By ANAHAD O'CONNOR and JULIE TURKEWITZ

lead_paragraph: For reasons that are not yet clear, hospitals in the Midwest and West are seeing an unusually large spike in suspected cases and a large number of children who need critical care.

headline.main: Respiratory Virus Sickens Children in the Midwest
headline.print_headline: Respiratory Virus Sickens Children in the Midwest

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations
